Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior: thin reserved band below rim, glazed black below; top of lip glazed; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of cock to left (head with added red on comb and wattle, shoulder, and part of body with large red dots remaining); below, at bottom of lip, narrow red band above black area at top of handle zone.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0562) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
